titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the John Douglas Cook papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff. Revised in 2012

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-03-21T09:40-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Reports, memoranda, interrogation transcripts, letters, and photographs, relating to the internment of Japanese Americans at Tule Lake during World War II. Includes a history by J. D. Cook of activities of the United States 316th Engineer Regiment in France and Belgium during World War I.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John Douglas Cook papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1970.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Reports officer, Tule Lake Relocation Center, California, 1942-1943.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Reports, memoranda, interrogation transcripts, letters, and photographs, relating to the internment of Japanese Americans at Tule Lake during World War II. Includes a history by J. D. Cook of activities of the United States 316th Engineer Regiment in France and Belgium during World War I.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. American Expeditionary Forces.
United States. Army. Corps of Engineers. Regiment, 316th.
controlaccess.subject: Japanese Americans--Evacuation and relocation, 1942-1945.
World War, 1914-1918--Engineering and construction.
World War, 1939-1945--United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes questionnaires by Japanese-American detainees and rosters

unittitle.emph: A Tule Lake Interlude: First Anniversary, May 27, 1942-1943,
